results.title: The Queen in Australia
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The Queen in Australia is a landmark in Australian history. It not only records the first visit by a reigning monarch to Australia, it was also the first colour, feature-length documentary made in this country. This historic program provides nationwide coverage of the 1954 Royal Tour by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh - a two-month journey that took in every facet of Australian life: garden parties at Government House, dancers at the Tivoli, racing at Randwick, tennis at Kooyong with Rosewall and Hoad, cricket with the Don, even a meeting with Papua New Guinean tribal chiefs. The young royals visited every state in the nation, and the result is a remarkable and revealing insight into our nation in the 1950s.

results.title: Palaeolithic man
results.brief_description: Illustrates the way of life of palaeolithic hunters and food gatherers, based on three sources of evidence that remain today - weapons and implements found near their primitive hearths, drawings from European cave settlements and the nomadic lives of Australian Aborigines.
results.description: Illustrates the way of life of palaeolithic hunters and food gatherers, based on three sources of evidence that remain today - weapons and implements found near their primitive hearths, drawings from European cave settlements and the nomadic lives of Australian Aborigines.

results.title: Native Earth
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A study of Australia’s responsibilities and administration issues in Papua New Guinea immediately after World War 2, with particular emphasis on the life and the needs of Papuans. Commentary by Peter Finch, researched by Catherine Duncan, script by Catherine Duncan, photography by Frank Bagnall, music by John Kay.

results.title: Namatjira the painter. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, Ralph Foster and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of Albert Namatjira, who once worked as a cook and camel-boy for the landscape painter Rex Batterbee. Namatjira became interested in painting and under Batterbee’s tuition, began to use watercolours to reproduce on canvas the Central Australian landscape. This vintage film, made at the height of Namatjira’s popularity shows the painter at work and discusses the influence of the environment on his beautiful original landscapes. Rich with illustrations of his work, this film is a tribute to the painter. Original ed. [307974].

results.title: The Mount Hagen Show
results.creator_credit: Boris Cook and Information and Extension Services for the people of Papua New Guinea
results.brief_description: A mass gathering of highland tribes of diverse customs was indicative of the beginnings of unity and prosperity in Papua and New Guinea. This was the hope expressed by Lord de L’Isle when he declared the Mount Hagen Show open. But it is only the beginning. The response of brightly painted feather bedecked natives to the throb of drums; the incongruousness of their participation in bicycle racing and dodgem cars; the mixed expressions of curiosity and distrust amongst the native spectators, clearly show that the path to change is a long one.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Boris Cook and Information and Extension Services for the people of Papua New Guinea

results.title: Mike and Stefani
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Mike and Stefani, a young Ukrainian couple, spent World War II in German labour camps. After the war the couple were reunited and as two of the eight million “displaced persons” in European refugee camps they sought to resettle in Australia. The film had a twofold purpose, to counter the criticism within Australia that post-war immigration procedures for such people were inadequate and that some “undesirables” were slipping through the net, and to encourage Australians to accept the sudden influx of non-British immigrants in the immediate post-war years. Photographer: R.G. Pearse.

results.title: Mexico 75: no place else in the world to be
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Centre for the Study of Educational Communication and Media, LaTrobe University
results.brief_description: A record of the International Women’s Conference in Mexico City in 1975. The film sets the Conference in the context of an underdeveloped country and discusses the relevance of the women’s movement to third world countries. There is special emphasis on the contribution of the Australian delegation.

results.title: The Melting pot
results.brief_description: A day in the life of the Victoria Market, Melbourne. Begins with the derelicts who haunt the area, the early arrival of delivery trucks and shows the hectic crowds of the market in full swing. Closes with the end of the market day with its inevitable clearing away of refuse and the departure of people.

results.title: The Man on the beat
results.creator_credit: Patricia Murray, Ralph Kemplen, Roger MacDougall and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: The duties and training of a London policeman, known over the world for his courtesy. The London policeman is unarmed, and his duties vary from finding lost children to directing traffic. Dealing with crime is only an occasional part of the ordinary London policeman’s job.

results.title: Launceston
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Edwards, Peter Young, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Aspects of life in Launceston. Industries include Paton and Baldwins woollen mills, Repco ball bearing factory, timber mills and furniture manufacturers. Shows schools, the general hospital, churches, and the historic home of Entally built in 1820. Motor racing at Longford, bicycyle racing, water skiing and archery are popular forms of recreation. Theatres, restaurants and night clubs, provide a variety of evening entertainment.
